title: Cardinal Pacelli at Montmartre, Paris
text: Here Henri Cartier-Bresson snapped what he termed a "decisive moment," capturing the emotive energy surrounding Cardinal Pacelli (who would be crowned Pope Pius XII the year after this photograph was taken). Masses of followers come to meet him in Montmartre, the quintessentially avant-garde quarter of Paris and a site of frequent artistic rebellion against religious figures.
description: man kissing the hand of a Cardinal
creditline: The Alfred and Ingrid Lenz Harrison Fund
